target.name: upgradeHelp
target.description: Prints description of how to use this script
target.echo: This script takes a caGrid 1.3 service that has been deployed into a tomcat
container and copies it into a new tomcat container that was created by the
caGrid ${targetVersion} installer. It replaces jars and may do some other things so that the
caGrid service will function in a ${targetVersion} environment.
No guarantee is made that the service will work correctly in its new
environment, though that is the goal.
To run this script to move a deployed caGrid 1.3 service into a caGrid ${targetVersion}
environment, first copy the caGrid 1.3 tomcat container directory (it will
usually be named apache-tomcat-5.5.27) to a location on the VM that will host
the caGrid ${targetVersion} version of the service.
Next, install caGrid ${targetVersion} and use the installer to create a tomcat container
for the service. Be sure not to put it under the same directory is the caGrid 1.3
After you have done the things described above, assuming that the environment
variable CONTAINER_1.3 is defined at the path of the caGrid 1.3 tomcat container
and CATALINA_HOME is the path of the newly created caGrid ${targetVersion} tomcat container,

target.name: _verifyContainer_1.3
target.fail: container_1.3 is not defined. It should be defined on the command line as the path of the caGrid 1.3 tomcat container.
